author: Prathibha Joy
title: Choreographing for Ring Master was a challenge
text:
When Arun Sagar, the lead actor of Ring Master, spoke to choreographer Imran Sardhariya about working on two songs, and the challenge that presented, it excited Imran.
"I have done over 250 songs at various fancy locations and budgets. But with Ring Master, the songs had to be confined to a certain space. I was allowed filmi liberties, as long as we didn't step out of a couple of rooms. My first thought was, 'How do I do it?' Luckily for me, they were shooting close by, so I could visit the set to figure out how they were shooting, camera placements, etc. I did my homework on the set. But what helped the most is that no one on the cast is a big star, so I was not restricted by an image or having to show any of them larger than life," says Imran.
For the Bangiranga song that Arun himself has sung, Imran had to create a 'nasha' feel. "We fit a GoPro to a fan and had Arun look into the camera as the fan rotated, giving the illusion that the whole room was spinning around him," he adds.
